title.rendered: “Massive Overnight Crackdown: IDF and Security Forces Arrest 33 Suspects Across Judea, Samaria, and Beyond”

content.rendered:
IDF spokesperson:

IDF soldiers, Shin Bet and Border Police arrested 33 wanted individuals overnight throughout Judea and Samaria, and in the Valley and Plains Brigade. In the Ein Beit Ilma refugee camp in Nablus, a suspect who fired at security forces was arrested.

Throughout the night, the forces operated in Judea and Samaria, and in the Valley and Plains Brigade, arresting 33 wanted individuals. In the Ein Beit Ilma refugee camp in Nablus, the forces arrested a suspect who fired at security forces. In the village of Beit Ummar in the Etzion Brigade, they confiscated a bag containing dozens of ready-to-use Molotov cocktails.

In the city of Hebron in the Judea Brigade, the forces arrested five wanted individuals and confiscated terror funds. In Beit Ula village in the brigade sector, seven wanted individuals were arrested.

In the city of Tul Karem in the Menashe Brigade, and in the village of Silwad in the Binyamin Brigade, the soldiers arrested eight wanted men suspected of involvement in terrorist activities.

The arrested suspects have been transferred for further investigation by the security forces, our forces did not suffer any injuries.

So far, over 3,000 wanted individuals have been arrested since the beginning of the war throughout the Judea and Samaria Division, and the Valley and Plains Brigade, over 1,350 of them affiliated with the Hamas terror organization.
